summary: This document is an email chain from June 2008 regarding the Epstein case, involving communication between a U.S. Attorney's Office and defense attorneys Kenneth Starr and Jay Lefkowitz. It discusses the submission of supplemental materials and scheduling a conference, indicating ongoing legal proceedings.

persons.name: Kenneth Starr
persons.context: Defense attorney from Kirkland & Ellis LLP representing Epstein, sending supplemental submissions and traveling abroad, requesting contact with his colleague Jay Lefkowitz.

persons.name: Jay Lefkowitz
persons.context: Colleague of Kenneth Starr at Kirkland & Ellis LLP, identified as the contact person while Starr is traveling.

connections.description: Legal colleagues at Kirkland & Ellis LLP working on the Epstein defense, with Lefkowitz serving as contact while Starr travels.

events.title: Submission of Supplemental Materials
events.description: Kenneth Starr sends supplemental submissions and a binder of materials to the Department of Justice regarding the Epstein case.

events.title: Scheduling of Telephone Conference
events.description: A telephone conference is planned for the afternoon or evening to inform defense counsel about the review status and timetable.

keyFacts: Kenneth Starr and Jay Lefkowitz of Kirkland & Ellis LLP were acting as defense attorneys for Jeffrey Epstein in June 2008.
The U.S. Attorney's Office was reviewing supplemental submissions from the defense, with a deadline around mid-June 2008.
The email chain shows coordination between prosecutors and defense counsel, with instructions not to contact defense until after a scheduled conference.
The correspondence is marked as confidential and potentially attorney-client privileged, indicating sensitive legal discussions.
